intro: Panicum parvum, commonly known as little barley, is a small annual grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has slender, cylindrical stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with pale green to brown bracts. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often have a slight sheen, while the seeds are small and wind-dispersed. Panicum parvum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
